results.title: The War game. Heroes
results.creator_credit: Maurice Sellar, Robert Sidaway and Rank Film Distributors
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Best of British”.
The War Game examines the British approach to war with scenes from some of the most famous movies ever made, such as” Waterloo Bridge”, “Henry V” and the “Life and times of Colonel Blimp”. “Heroes” makes the comparison between heroes of American cinema and their British counterparts. A tribute is made to the “stiff upper lip” hero played by the likes of Leslie Howard, Jack Hawkins, Stewart Granger, Alec Guinness and David Niven in a variety of roles from spy to school boy. Narrated by Sir John Mills.

results.title: The Ladies' man; Lord Byron lived here; The Lift
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hancock’s half hour”.
Three episodes from the British television comedy series “Hancock” starring Tony Hancock. 1. The Ladies man: Hancock decides to take things into his own hands and improve his success rate with the opposite sex. 2. Lord Byron lives here: The discovery of scribblings by the great poet Byron leads Hancock to open his house as a stately home, exploit the American tourists and make a fortune at the same time. The Lift: What a captive audience has top put up with when Hancock tips the balance of one too many in the lift and the lift won’t budge.

results.title: The Nargun and the stars
results.brief_description: Based on Patricia Wrightson’s novel “The Nargun and the stars”, this timeless story takes you to the inner heart of aboriginal myths and The Dreaming.

results.title: Nargun
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Nargun and the stars”.
Based on Patricia Wrightson’s novel of the same name, this is the story of Simon Brent, a city boy who comes to live with his country relatives after the death of his parents. In this episode Simon must finally face the menacing giant rock, The Nargun.

results.title: Nyols
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Nargun and the stars”.
Based on Patricia Wrightsons novel of the same name, this is the story of Simon Brent who comes to live with country relatives when his parents are killed. In this episode Simon and his cousins Charlie and Eddie discover the menacing Nyols.

results.title: Turongs
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Nargun and the stars”.
Based on the novel by Patricia Wrightson, this story of Simon Brent, the city boy who comes to live with his country relatives after the death of his parents, follows the adventures of Simon and his cousins as they meet and battle menacing creatures from the Aboriginal dreamtime. In this episode the intrepid adventurers come face to face with the Turongs.

results.title: Potkoorok
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Nargun and the stars”.
Based on the novel of the same name by Patricia Wrightson, this is the story of Simon Brent, a city boy sent to live with country relatives after the death of his parents. He resents the move to a different lifestyle and is bored with country life until he meets some ancient creatures that have inhabited the area since Dreamtime. In this episode he stumbles upon The Potkoorok, a fierce and loathesome creature.

results.title: Simon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Nargun and the stars”.
A television adaptation of Patricia Wrightson’s novel of the same name, this series is the story of Simon Brent, a 10 year old city boy who is placed in the care of country relatives when his parents are killed in a car crash. Simon finds life very boring until he explores a nearby swamp, where he experiences some odd happenings and finally meets a strange swamp creature called The Potkoorok. From that time on, life is considerably more exciting, mysterious and dangerous for Simon and his relatives, Charlie and Eddie, as they do battle with a menacing giant rock known as The Nargun.
